pages.text: Bomakellia kelleri comes from the late Ediacaran, with fossils found in the Ust-Pinega Formation, Russia. It is a small petalonamid lifeform, growing up to 9 cm in height. Until recently, Due to its poor preservation, Bomakellia was originally thought to be some form of arthropod, and possibly even a primitive anomalocarid, although this hypothesis was note widely accepted, with some even outright ignoring it, with more recent studies suggesting it to be apart of
the phylum Petalonamae, and classified further in the family Charniidae.
